required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Oral NNZ-2591 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Combined Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Profile of NNZ-2591 in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of NNZ-2591 when administered to healthy volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is in two stages:
Stage 1: A First-in-Human (FIH), single dose escalation study of oral NNZ-2591 in healthy volunteers to establish safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic parameters.
Stage 2: A First-in-Human (FIH), multiple dose escalation study of oral NNZ-2591 in healthy volunteers to establish safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic parameters.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Stage 1: Single ascending dose with 3 dose cohorts Stage 2: Multiple ascending doses with 2 dose cohorts

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability measured through Adverse Events /Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: The frequency and severity of Adverse Events in healthy volunteers administered single and repeated oral doses of NNZ-2591

secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) of NNZ-2591
Area under the concentration-time curve from time 0 to infinity of NNZ-2591

arm_group.description: Single Ascending Dose (SAD) of oral NNZ-2591 in healthy volunteers
Single Ascending Dose (SAD) of oral NNZ-2591 in healthy volunteers
Single Ascending Dose (SAD) of oral NNZ-2591 in healthy volunteers
Multiple Ascending Dose (MAD) of oral NNZ-2591 in healthy volunteers
Multiple Ascending Dose (MAD) of oral NNZ-2591 in healthy volunteers

intervention.description: Single ascending dose and multiple ascending doses of NNZ-2591

facility.name: Linear Clinical Research, The Queen Elizabeth II Medical Centre
